meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of reform.
meanings.sent1: Her strong reformism led her to fight for changes in the education system.
meanings.sent2: Many people support reformism to improve society.
meanings.sent3: His passion for reformism made him the hero of the town hall meetings.
meanings.sent4: The seed of reformism planted in the community started to grow into a mighty tree of progress.
meanings.sent5: The bright banner of reformism waved proudly in the wind, inspiring hope in the hearts of the people.

meanings.definition: The principles and practices of reformers.
meanings.sent1: The history books highlighted the impact of reformism on social change.
meanings.sent2: Reformism often involves peaceful protests and petitions.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed the quirks of reformism in action.
meanings.sent4: In the battlefield of ideas, reformism stood as a shining sword against injustice.
meanings.sent5: The essence of reformism permeated every aspect of their community, guiding them towards a better future.
